Vučić ponovo traži od EU odgovore o navodnom trovanju u CIK u Prištini

03 Nov 2019, 12:35

Predsednik Srbije Aleksandar Vučić uputio je još jedno pismo portparolki Evropske unije Maji Kocijančić u kome traži rezultate istrage o navodnom masovnom trovanju "na jednonacionalnoj osnovi" u Centralnoj izbornoj komisiji u Prištini, navodeći da je prošlo tri nedelje od tog dogadjaja."Draga Majo Kocijančić, prošlo je više od tri nedelje od kada je nastupilo kako su Albanci tvrdili, masovno trovanje na jednonacionalnoj osnovi u CIK u Prištini. Molim Vas, draga Majo, da nam konačno kažete da li je u pitnju bio antraks, novičok ili možda sredstvo za čišćenje nameštaja," piše u pismu koje je Vučić objavio danas na svom Tviter nalogu.On je dodao da "dok je živ" neće odustati od odgovora na to važna pitanja.Vučić je izrazio žaljenje što se tako strašnom stvari, u kojoj su navodno učestvovali Srbi, očigledno ne bavi ni EU ni izaslanik SAD za zapadni Balkan Metju Palmer.

Vucic again asks EU for answers on alleged CEC poisoning in Pristina

03 Nov 2019, 12:35

Serbian President Aleksandar Vucic has sent another letter to European Union Spokeswoman Maja Kocijancic requesting the results of an investigation into alleged mass poisoning "on a one-national basis" at the Central Election Commission in Pristina, stating that three weeks have passed since the event. "Dear Majo Kocijancic, It has been more than three weeks since the Albanians claimed a massive, one-ethnic mass poisoning in the CEC in Pristina, please, dear Mayo, to finally tell us if there was an anthrax, novice or maybe a furniture cleaner , "he writes in a letter published by Vucic today on his Twitter account. He added that" while he is alive "he will not give up answering important questions. Vucic regretted that such a terrible thing, involving Serbs, was allegedly involved. apparently neither EU nor US envoy for the Western Balkans Matthew Palmer is concerned.
